thread.title: Mexico's 'cooking nun' takes TV shot to pay order's debts
thread.title_full: Mexico's 'cooking nun' takes TV shot to pay order's debts

title: Mexico's 'cooking nun' takes TV shot to pay order's debts
text: > Entertainment Mexico's 'cooking nun' takes TV shot to pay order's debts Sixty-eight-year-old Florinda Ruiz Carapia, better known as "Hermana Flor," grills thin-cut flank steaks in the kitchen of her convent, the Pontifical Palafoxiano Seminary, in Puebla, Mexico, Wednesday, Sept. 30, 2015. At the seminary in the central state of Puebla where she cooks three meals a day for 150 seminarians, Hermana Flor runs a simple but sustainable and nutritious operation. “The steaks we have here are paper thin; you put them on the grill and they’re done. We don’t have any medium, medium-rare, none of that here.” (AP Photo/Eduardo Verdugo)
